glossary.definition: An enrollment request for a specific training program or course
An employee enrolled in a training program or course
A stage in the training application process (e.g., pending, approved, in-progress, completed)
The completion status and advancement through training content

business_rules: Training applications must be associated with valid training program or course
Participants must meet prerequisites before enrollment
Application approval may be required based on program type or cost
Training progress must be tracked and updated as participant advances
Application phases must be completed in sequence
Participants can withdraw from training with proper notification
Training completion requires all required content to be finished
Completion certificates are issued upon successful completion
Training history is maintained for each participant
Participants can be enrolled in multiple training programs simultaneously
invariants: Training application must be associated with valid program or course
Application status must be valid (pending, approved, rejected, in-progress, completed, withdrawn)
Application cannot be completed without finishing all required content
edge_cases: Participant withdraws mid-training - system handles partial completion, maintains progress history
Training program is cancelled - system notifies participants, handles refunds or rescheduling if applicable
Participant fails assessment - system allows retake based on policy, tracks attempts
Application approval is delayed - system sends reminders, may auto-approve after timeout
Participant completes training early - system marks complete, issues certificate, allows new enrollment
Training content is updated during enrollment - system maintains participant in original version or migrates based on policy
Participant is terminated - system handles training records, may complete or cancel based on policy
Prerequisites are not met - system blocks enrollment, shows missing prerequisites, allows prerequisite completion
compliance_requirements: Training records must be retained for compliance and audit purposes
Completion certificates must be verifiable and tamper-proof
Training history must be maintained for each employee
Application approvals must be documented with approver and reason
Training data must comply with privacy regulations
user_journeys: Employee applies for training - selects program, system checks prerequisites, application is created
Manager approves training application - reviews request, approves or rejects, participant is notified
Participant starts training - accesses content, progress is tracked, reminders are sent if inactive
Participant completes training - finishes all content, passes assessments, completion is recorded
System issues completion certificate - certificate is generated, participant receives notification and certificate
acceptance_criteria_suggestions: Given training application, when prerequisites are met, then application is created and submitted for approval
Given application approval, when manager approves, then participant is enrolled and notified
Given training progress, when content is accessed, then progress is tracked and updated
Given training completion, when all content is finished, then completion is recorded and certificate is issued
Given participant withdrawal, when withdrawal is requested, then application is cancelled and history is maintained
open_questions: What is the application approval workflow? (manager? HR? automatic?)
How are prerequisites validated? (automatic check? manual review?)
What happens when training is not completed? (deadline? extension? cancellation?)
How are completion certificates generated? (template? digital signature?)
What is the process for training program cancellation? (refunds? rescheduling?)
How are training assessments handled? (passing score? retake policy?)
assumptions: Training applications require approval for certain program types
Participants must meet prerequisites before enrollment
Training progress is tracked automatically as content is accessed
Completion certificates are issued upon successful completion
Training history is maintained for each participant
